featured.text: The government did not issue a warning about the disease in time.
At the moment EU tobacco manufacturers only have to put written health warnings on cigarette packets __(24)__
And this is certainly a serious warning about the depressing fate of other glaciers around the world.
Upon the super typhoon warning, Nancy rushed to the supermarket—only to find the shelves almost ______ and the stock nearly gone.
The barking of the hound, which drives deer to panic, strengthens the effect of the warning noise, according to the RTRI.

definition.zh_def: 警告；提醒某人注意潛在的危險或問題。
definition.en_def: A statement or indication that something bad or dangerous may happen.
definition.example: The weather service issued a warning about the approaching storm.
